utils¶

dlinputs.utils.get_string_mapping(kvp)[source]¶

Returns a dictionary mapping strings to strings.

This can take either a string of the form “name=value:name2=value2” or a dictionary containing all string keys and values.

Parameters:kvp – dictionary or string
Returns:dictionary
dlinputs.utils.invert_mapping(kvp)[source]¶

Inverts the mapping given by a dictionary.

Parameters:kvp – mapping to be inverted
Returns:inverted mapping
Return type:dictionary
dlinputs.utils.make_gray(image)[source]¶

Converts any image to a grayscale image by averaging.

Knows about alpha channels etc.

Parameters:image – rank 2 or 3 ndarray
Returns:rank 2 ndarray
dlinputs.utils.make_rgb(image)[source]¶

Converts any image to an RGB image.

Knows about alpha channels etc.

Parameters:image – rank 2 or 3 ndarray
Returns:rank 3 ndarray of shape :,:,3
dlinputs.utils.make_rgba(image, alpha=255)[source]¶

Converts any image to an RGBA image.

Knows about alpha channels etc.

Parameters:
  • image – rank 2 or 3 ndarray
  • alpha – default alpha value
Returns:

rank 3 ndarray with shape :,:,4
dlinputs.utils.pildumps(image, format='PNG')[source]¶

Compress an image using PIL and return it as a string.

Can handle float or uint8 images.

Parameters:
  • image – ndarray representing an image
  • format – compression format (“PNG” or “JPEG”)
dlinputs.utils.pilpng(image, format='PNG')¶

Compress an image using PIL and return it as a string.

Can handle float or uint8 images.

Parameters:
  • image – ndarray representing an image
  • format – compression format (“PNG” or “JPEG”)
dlinputs.utils.pilread(stream, color='gray', asfloat=True)[source]¶

Read an image from a stream using PIL.

Parameters:
  • stream – stream to read the image from
  • color – “gray”, “rgb” or “rgba”.
  • asfloat – return float image instead of uint8 image
dlinputs.utils.pilreads(data, color, asfloat=True)[source]¶

Read an image from a string or buffer using PIL.

Parameters:
  • data – data to be decoded
  • color – “gray”, “rgb” or “rgba”.
  • asfloat – return float instead of uint8
dlinputs.utils.print_sample(sample)[source]¶

Pretty print a standard sample.

Parameters:sample (dict) – key value pairs used for training
dlinputs.utils.samples_to_batch(samples, combine_tensors=True, expand=False)[source]¶

Take a collection of samples (dictionaries) and create a batch.

If tensors is True, ndarray objects are combined into tensor batches.

Parameters:
  • samples (dict) – list of samples
  • tensors (bool) – whether to turn lists of ndarrays into a single ndarray
Returns:

single sample consisting of a batch
Return type:

dict
dlinputs.utils.samples_to_batch_expanded(samples)[source]¶

Take a collection of samples (dictionaries) and create a batch.

Parameters:samples (dict) – list of samples
Returns:single sample consisting of a batch
Return type:dict
